description.narrative: Policies to contain deficit, manage debt, concessional financing, reform the Land Registry and Cadastre administration. Digitalize Tax and Customs. Support commitments to reducing greenhouse emissions financing and address oil and gas sector needs.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: Government’s ability to improve the performance of institutions and promote participation and accountability increased.

comment.narrative: Progress achieved in terms of fiscal reform and management by 2016; no national budget voted since 2005; automation of processes started in 2015-6.
Economic and fiscal Advisory role Legal Advisory Multilateral Coordination Tax Reform Customs Reform

- Launched debt restructuring of Eurobonds upon the government’s announcement of withholding all Eurobond payments starting March 7, 2020 and analyzed different scenarios for new offers. - Updated the medium-term macro-fiscal framework, on a monthly basis, including projections of macroeconomic assumptions and fiscal metrics in order to analyze Lebanons fiscal and debt sustainability and future financing needs and promote evidence-based decision making at the Ministry of Finance - Conducted, with the Revenues Directorate introductory training sessions (organized by the Institute of Finance), to the directors and the civil servants of the different departments of the ministry of finance - Enhanced aid coordination mechanism through strengthened dialogue on portfolio development with individual donor.

Forex debt exchange, voted petroleum legislations, new salary scale report,rating agencies and IMF visits covered and supported,updated macroeconomic framework post elections Petroleum legislations enacted, successful global forum review, successful liability management Increased funding for infrastructure, aid and climate purposes Decreased tax gap, improved services (time, cost) provision, increased revenues collection Kick off the land registry and cadastre modernization project which is funded by the world bank

Output1. Economic and fiscal Advisory role provided Prepared an advisory note to the Minister for ministerial discussions on needed economic and fiscal reforms over the short and medium terms. Prepared a comprehensive analysis to the minister on debt financing for the 2018-2019 period and a proposal for liability management of foreign currency debt maturities to reduce debt financing cost. Updated the medium-term macro-fiscal framework for 2018 onwards including projections of macroeconomic assumptions and fiscal metrics. Provided an internal assessment of the 2018 budget. Developed further the Oil and Gas financial Model through benchmarking analysis with Egypt and Cyprus. Completed monthly and quarterly reports (Personal cost Jan-June 2017, Euromain Jan-Feb 2018, Public Finance Monitor Jan-Nov 2017, Completed draft version for annual report 2016 after receiving final data, average cost for treasury bills and bonds Jan-Feb 2018). Followed up on the oil and gas draft laws in parliament and provided advisory notes to the Minister of Finance on the topic. Followed up with S&P, and Moody’s rating agencies on their draft country credit reports.
Output 2: Legal Advisory
Reviewed, commented and conducted negotiations for the World Bank loans and granst and followed up on the file with the Council of Ministers for approval and signature namely: “Greater Beirut Urban Transport Project” (loan negotiated on February 16, 2018). Prepared with the Revenues Department a PowerPoint presentation for the introductory session of the training done by the Institute of Finance to the civil servants, regarding the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) and the Exchange of Information on Request (EOIR) and present it before the directors of the departments of the ministry of finance. Finalized the Exchange of Information Manual Worked on the French version of the Lebanese model of IPPA Output 3: Multilateral Coordination Support the Minister on the technical committee of the Lebanon Crisis Response Plan (LCRP), an inter-governmental/inter-agency committee on managing the humanitarian and development aid for the Syrian crisis Support the Office of the Minister of State for Women Affairs in developing policies that will improve the gender gap in Lebanon Output 4: Tax Reform E-services: - Data reconciliation between the e-services and SIGTAS was performed to guarantee data consistency. - Support to VAT e-services and e-payment continued.
• BPR of the Tax functions - New tax forms were designed to simplify the tax procedures, for self-assessment and audit partial payment - Reconciliation between the Treasury System and VAT distribution of deductions in SIGTAS was carried out - VAT Arrears were prepared for the years 2002 until 2016. - Consolidation of all deductions and assessments reports - New procedures for the BDL’s VAT settlements were developed - New reports for compliance, data processing and refunds departments were designed - The automatic issuance of VAT registration certificates including the e-signature of the head of department was developed and implemented
• Overhauling the MOFs English Website - Real-time translation of MOF’s latest news, decisions, notices, procedures and activities was ensured.
Output 5: Customs Reform The e-Manifest project was implemented in the airport in order to receive the manifest from abroad. The Part shipment was developed in order to cover the goods that arrive on different flights although they belong to the same bill of lading Output 6: Land Registry and Cadastre Reform Data Analysis was conducted to the development of multiple statistical reports concerning the foreign ownerships in Lebanon Data analysis was performed to extract a new report regarding sale transactions sent to the Financial Prosecution Department Monitoring the nationality correction of foreign individual real estate owners

. Forex debt exchange . Voted petroleum legislation . new salary scale report . Rating agencies and IMF visits covered and supported . Updated macroeconomic framework post elections . Successful liability management

 Provision of economic and fiscal advice, including on reviewing the sovereign rating agencies reports, provision of macroeconomic and fiscal updates to the IMF during the 2019 missions, evaluation of impact of 2019 budget, simplification of public debt models, proposal on fiscal reform plan, etc…  Legal advisory on euro bonds/contractor and expropriation bonds, global forum on transparency of information for tax purposes, investment agreements (protection and promotion, cooperation and facilitation), and to the national committee to fight the funding of terrorism and on money laundering.  Multilateral coordination, leading to work closely with other ministries through platforms such as the LCRP, but also with other UNDP projects addressing critical interventions from a fiscal and/or macroeconomic perspective such as climate change and gender. Also, working and coordinating closely with World Bank and the European Investment Bank (FEMIP).  Tax reform, including the provision of e-services, data reconciliation, and e-banking for specific transactions. Specific functions were also addressed in the fields of petroleum tax, VAT, audit, etc..On taxes administration exchange missions were also supported with France.  Customs reform: support was made in terms of procurement, updating and maintaining of systems, launching of a warning system for unpaid declaration (as a step towards revenue collection).  Land Registry and Cadatsre: Analysis to facilitate processes, as well as standardization of processes.
